roleset.name: clean, make clear or open

example.name: with dirt
example.text: Inquiry clears Texas judge of bias in comments on homosexual murder victims.
example.arg: in comments on homosexual murder victims

roleset.note: Member of VNcls clear-10.3-1, preparing-26.3-1, other_cos-45.4, free-80-1.

roleset.name: approve

example.name: just plain transitive
example.text: A.L. Williams Corp. was merged into Primerica Corp., New York, after a special meeting of Williams shareholders cleared the transaction, the companies said.
example.arg: a special meeting of Williams shareholders

example.name: clear the way
example.text: In a surprise move, the British government cleared the way for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC by agreeing to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker.
example.arg: for a bidding war for Jaguar PLC
by agreeing to remove an obstacle to a takeover of the auto maker
example.note: This is really a blend of the 'clean' and 'approve' senses, but notice that "a bidding war" is still the thing approved--not "the way"!

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: [Dime Savings Bank of New York]-1 was cleared *trace*-1 by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. to acquire Starpointe Savings Bank of Somerset, N.J., the banks said.
example.arg: by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.
to acquire Starpointe Savings Bank of Somerset, N.J.,
example.note: oh my goodness I hate this example. Things are bad, people.

roleset.note: Comparison to 'approve'. No appropriate VN class.

roleset.name: escape, avoid

example.name: transitive
example.text: [The compromise plan, which boosts the minimum wage for the first time since 1981,]-1 is expected *trace*-1 to clear the Senate soon.

roleset.note: What's interesting about this roleset is that it's the exact opposite of the 'approve' roleset; you could also say 'the Senate cleared the compromise'. Disambiguation machines are going to have a fit over this.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'clear' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.

roleset.name: become/make clear, clean

example.name: clear up my acne?
example.text: But it is puzzling to some Hollywood executives that Sony-1 rushed to hire them without *trace*-1 clearing up the Warner situation first.

roleset.note: Essentially the same as the 'clean' roleset. See VNcls clear-10.3-1.
